required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Cultural-based Diabetes Program for Native Hawaiians

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK)

clinical_study.source: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases (NIDDK)

brief_summary.textblock: The Native Hawaiian Diabetes Intervention Program is a project focused on determining whether a cultural-based, healthy lifestyles program with family support will have a positive effect on lifestyle behaviors and psychosocial and clinical outcomes. A culturally sensitive, lifestyle intervention program was administered via community peer educators to a population of Native Hawaiians with or at risk for diabetes. The effect of this intervention program on selected outcomes is being compared to a ''standard'' program given to a similar population in a second Native Hawaiian community.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participant must be a Native Hawaiian adult 30 years of age or older residing in the research community and have diabetes or at-risk for diabetes.
- Family support member must be 18 years or older and live in the study community and be willing to go through the entire program with the participant as their support person.
- Physician clearance to participate in the program.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy

facility.name: University of Hawaii, John A. Burns School of Medicine

reference.citation: Gilliland SS, Carter JS, Perez GE, Two Feathers J, Kenui CK, Mau MK. Recommendations for Development and Adaptation of Culturally Competent Community Health Interventions in Minority Populations with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus. Diabetes Spectrum, 11(3):166-174, 1998.

Mau MK, Glanz K Chen R, Crabbe K, Severino R, Grove J, Curb JD, Arakaki RF. Lifestyle Behaviors and Mediating Factors for Behavior Change in Response to a Culturally-Responsive Intervention for Native Hawaiians. Diabetes, 1391A, 1999

Mau MK, Grandinetti A, Arakaki RF, Chang HK, Kinney EK, Curb JD. The insulin resistance syndrome in native Hawaiians. Native Hawaiian Health Research (NHHR) Project. Diabetes Care. 1997 Sep;20(9):1376-80.
Diabetes mellitus and heart disease risk factors in Hawaiians. The Native Hawaiian Health Research Project, RCMI Program. Hawaii Med J. 1994 Dec;53(12):340-3, 364.

Grandinetti A, Chang HK, Mau MK, Curb JD, Kinney EK, Sagum R, Arakaki RF. Prevalence of glucose intolerance among Native Hawaiians in two rural communities. Native Hawaiian Health Research (NHHR) Project. Diabetes Care. 1998 Apr;21(4):549-54.
